alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:52AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, Carroll and east central Washington Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 551 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Urbanette to 2 miles northwest of Marble to 7 miles south of Wesley. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Berryville... Huntsville... Eureka Springs... Green Forest... Elkins... St. Paul... Hindsville... Wesley... Carrollton... Rudd... Forum... Aurora... Clifty... Boston... Withrow Springs State Park... Marble... Rule... Kingston... Pettigrew... Japton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
